node.title: COVID-19 restrictions are being eased in NSW today — this is what's changing
node.alt: a family sitting at a table eating outdoors
node.description: New freedoms for those who are fully vaccinated come into effect after the NSW government moves its COVID-19 roadmap forward. Here's what's changed.
node.content:
["New freedoms for fully vaccinated people have come into effect today after the NSW government moved its COVID-19 roadmap forward.", "Originally slated for December 1, many freedoms not seen since before the Delta outbreak began in June\u00a0have returned.", "If you're\u00a0yet to receive both jabs, you'll need\u00a0to wait until December 15, or, until the state reaches 95 per cent double dose coverage for people aged\u00a016 or older, before any of this applies to you.", "This is what's changing today.", "
What restrictions have eased?
", "Caps on home visitors\u00a0and density limits for outdoor gatherings of fewer than 1,000 people have been\u00a0abolished.", "Those who are\u00a0fully vaccinated\u00a0will be able to hit the dance floor in nightclubs, which were previously open only for drinking.", "Indoor swimming pools are able to open for leisure and paddling, rather than just laps and swimming lessons.", "", "
Dancing is now allowed at nightclubs.(ABC News: Harriet Tatham)
", "Businesses that had been subjected to indoor density limits of one person per 4 square metres can now have one person per 2sqm.", "There will no longer be booking limits at hospitality venues.\u00a0", "Entertainment facilities with fixed seating capacities\u00a0like stadiums, theatres and cinemas will be able to operate at 100 per cent capacity, while other places like theme parks and zoos will be subject to the 2sqm\u00a0density limits instead of the current caps.", "Sex services premises will also reopen from today.", "
What isn't changing?
", "Gym and dance classes will continue to be capped at 20 people.", "You'll still be required to wear a mask in indoor settings\u00a0such as supermarkets until December 15 (or, when 95 per cent of the state's population aged 16 and over is fully vaccinated).", "", "
The cap on 20 people at gyms is among the restrictions that remain.\u00a0(ABC News: Tim Swanston)
", "
What about people who aren't vaccinated?
", "People who are not vaccinated were originally promised more freedoms on December 1.", "They'll now have to wait until 95 per cent of people aged 16 or over\u00a0in NSW are double vaccinated, or until December 15 \u2013 whichever one comes\u00a0first.", "Until then, they will essentially have to continue living in lockdown.", "They'll only be allowed to enter essential businesses\u00a0(like supermarkets),\u00a0but barred from everywhere else, including hospitality venues, gyms and non-essential retail settings.", "The only exception is places of worship, which unvaccinated people are permitted to attend.", "", "
Places of worship are among the few freedoms allowed for unvaccinated people.(ABC News: Lydia Feng)
", "
Why were changes brought forward?
", "Premier Dominic Perrottet said\u00a0the changes had been made possible by faster-than-expected vaccination rates and the introduction of booster doses.", "", "
Today's changes were originally slated for December 1.(ABC News: Kamin Gock)
", "Mr Perrottet said he hoped pushing back the date for extra freedoms for the unvaccinated\u00a0would\u00a0encourage more people to get the jab.", "\"We believe that by moving that date back to the 15th of December it will incentivise people,\" he said last week.", "\"We are hopeful that we can get that rate up to 95 per cent \u2014 that will not just be nation-leading, it will be world-leading as well.\"", "NSW chief health officer Kerry Chant warned people to remain cautious.", "\"It is critical that as we go through this transition phase, we need to retain those COVID\u00a0safe practices,\" she said.", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
"]
